title: Cybercrime marketplace Genesis Market shut by FBI, international law enforcement
description: The takedown, dubbed Operation Cookie Monster, targeted an online marketplace that allowed criminals to impersonate consumers online.

title: Trump falsified business records to 'cover up crimes' related to 2016 election, Manhattan DA says
description: Trump pleaded not guilty to 34 felony counts of falsifying business records stemming from DA Bragg's hush money probe.

title: Manhattan DA sheds new light on National Enquirer publisher's efforts to boost Trump 2016 campaign
description: Manhattan District Attorney Bragg's probe sheds new light on the relationship between Donald Trump and the then-parent company of the National Enquirer.

title: Read the indictment against Donald Trump, details of payments to porn star, Playboy model
description: Former President Donald Trump pleaded not guilty in a New York courtroom for a criminal case related to a hush money payment to porn star Stormy Daniels.

title: Bill Gates' daughter reportedly paid $51 million for this NYC penthouse—it comes with 3,400 square feet of outdoor space
description: Theresa Genovese, principal at CetraRuddy Architecture, tells CNBC Make It the penthouse is the largest residence at 443 Greenwich St.

title: J&J will pay $8.9 billion to settle claims cosmetic talc products caused cancer
description: Johnson & Johnson said it would pay an $8.9 billion settlement over claims that its talc-based baby powder caused cancer.

title: The salary you need to live comfortably in 15 major U.S. cities
description: St. Louis is the cheapest place to live for the second year in a row. The average take-home salary needed to live comfortably in America is $68,499.

title: Amazon lays off more than 100 employees in its video games division: Read the memo here
description: The layoffs included employees in the Game Growth group, its San Diego gaming studios, and Prime Gaming, Amazon Games VP Christoph Hartmann wrote in the memo.

title: Read the indictment against Donald Trump, details of payments to porn star, Playboy model
description: Former President Donald Trump pleaded not guilty in a New York courtroom for a criminal case related to a hush money payment to porn star Stormy Daniels.

title: Virgin Orbit COO calls out company leadership for failures in goodbye memo. Read the full email
description: An email from Virgin Orbit's outgoing Chief Operating Officer Tony Gingiss appears to call out CEO Dan Hart, although not by name.

title: GM overtakes Ford as second-best seller of EVs in U.S. but still trails Tesla by a wide margin
description: General Motors pulled ahead of Ford Motor to become the country's second-best seller of electric vehicles during the first quarter.

title: Cuba's losses in case of Castro-era debt opens it up to more lawsuits
description: Cuba will likely face more suits over billions of dollars' worth of unpaid commercial debts from the 1980s after a decision by a UK High Court judge.

title: Frank founder criminally charged with fraud over $175 million JPMorgan deal
description: Prosecutors accused Charlie Javice of inflating Frank's user base before selling the startup to JPMorgan Chase.

title: American teens aren't excited about virtual reality, with only 4% using it daily
description: "To us, the lukewarm usage demonstrates that VR remains 'early days' and that these devices are less important than smartphones," Piper Sandler analysts wrote.

title: Finland officially becomes a member of NATO, doubling the military alliance's border with Russia
description: It's a historic moment for Finland, which has followed a path of neutrality for decades.

title: TikTok fined $16 million in UK for misusing kids' data as scrutiny of Chinese-owned app intensifies
description: TikTok has been fined £12.7 ($15.9) million by U.K. privacy regulators for failing to protect children's data, in a fresh blow to the Chinese-owned app.

title: Jamie Dimon says the banking crisis is not over and will cause ‘repercussions for years to come’
description: The annual letter from the JPMorgan CEO addressed the state of the banking system after the collapse of SVB.

title: Italy became the first Western country to ban ChatGPT. Here's what other countries are doing
description: Italy isn't the only country reckoning with the rapid pace of AI progression and its implications for society.

title: Russia's ultranationalists appear increasingly vulnerable after pro-war blogger's killing
description: The death of Vladlen Tatarsky, one of Russia's most vocal and prominent pro-war supporters, has shaken the country's nationalist commentariat.

title: Credit Suisse shareholders gather at annual meeting to demand answers over UBS rescue
description: A police presence was established outside the Credit Suisse annual meeting as shareholders began arriving in droves.

title: Virgin Orbit files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the U.S.
description: Virgin Orbit on Tuesday filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the U.S. after failing to secure a funding lifeline.

title: Asia faces 'tough decisions' on inflation as oil prices rise, ADB says
description: Higher oil prices will challenge regional governments to make "tough decisions" to tackle inflation pressures, said Albert Park, chief economist at ADB.

title: A green transition will require trillions of dollars. It'll be a 'tall order' to find the cash, but there's hope
description: The International Energy Agency says clean energy investment will need to hit over $4 trillion a year by 2030.

title: China’s homebuyers are starting to come back
description: More people in China want to buy houses again, according to a first quarter survey released Monday by the People's Bank of China.

title: Manhattan real estate sales plunge 38%, but cash deals hit all-time record
description: Manhattan real estate sales fell 38% in the first quarter, as buyers and sellers battled over prices and mortgage rates remained volatile.

title: After a 'rollercoaster' quarter, strategists are still relatively upbeat about Asia-Pacific markets
description: Economists predict China's recovery will cushion the dampening effect of high global interest rates on the regional economy.
